intro: Danaea oblanceolata, commonly known as the broadleaf danaea, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family, characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with lance-shaped leaves that are often glaucous in appearance. Its flowers are usually pink or red, with five petals and a distinctive tubular throat. Danaea oblanceolata is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
